text: thumb|right|Carlqvist in 1978 Håkan Carlqvist (15 January 1954 - 7 July 2017) was a Swedish professional motocross racer. He was born near Stockholm, Sweden."Håkan Carlqvist 50 år". HD.se, 13 January 2004. Retrieved 2012-03-06. Carlqvist won the F.I.M. 250cc Motocross World Championship in 1979 as a member of the Husqvarna factory racing team. In 1980, he switched to Yamaha to contest the 500cc motocross world championship. He finished 3rd in 1981 and 1982. In 1983, he battled against Honda teammates André Malherbe and Graham Noyce to claim the 500cc world championship, on a Yamaha.Håkan Carlqvist career profile In 1984, an injury stopped Carlqvist from contesting the title again. He raced for Yamaha until end of 1986. Carlqvist died in Stockholm on 7 July 2017 of a heart attack at the age of 63. ==References== Category:1954 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Sportspeople from Stockholm
title: Håkan Carlqvist
